ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course is a great way to strengthen your French writing skills in multiple disciplines. I improved in: analytical, persuasive, creative, career-oriented, and humorous writing styles. My syntax and grammar improved greatly, and I did a lot of work on developing my own style.
I improved my skills in written French through a variety of forms of writing. We working on grammar, as well as style and form.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is wonderfully organized! I don't have any suggestions for improvement. The assignments are clear and the 3-draft structure of them is excellent not just to improve our French writing but also our discipline as academic writers in general.

The workload in this course is very heavy, but I found almost all of it to be worthwhile. From time to time, the grammar exercises were a bit tedious and repetitive, but the drafting process for the larger assignments was very helpful and getting feedback from the class was very valuable.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES!!! Especially if you love writing, please take this course. Your writing will improve greatly and you will get practice with a lot of various styles. You will receive peer feedback and professor feedback and have the opportunity to develop your French vocabulary and your skill as a writer.
I would only recommend this course to another student very serious about learning French who enjoys writing a lot, otherwise I don't think the workload would be worth it.
